p: The most promising recently published anti-malarial flavanones and flavones derived from the African flora have been summarized in Table 3. These include 5,4′-dihydroxy-3,6,7-trimethoxyflavone ( 37), 5,7-dihydroxy-3,4′-dimethoxyflavone ( 38), quercetin-3,4′-dimethyl ether ( 39), rhamnazin ( 40), retusin ( 41), 5,4′-dihydroxy-3,7,3′-trimethoxyflavone ( 42), 5,4′-dihydroxy-7-dimethoxyflavanone ( 43), (+)-tephrodin ( 44), tachrosin ( 45), obovatin methyl ether ( 46), morreloflavone ( 47), volkensiflavone ( 48), and 5-demethyltangeretin ( 49), whose chemical structures of are shown in Fig. 11. The compounds were isolated from the species Senecio roseiflorus (Compositae-Asteraceae) [ 76], Tephrosia villosa (Leguminosae) [ 77], Allanblackia floribunda (Guttiferae) [ 78], and Peperomia vulcanica (Piperaceae) [ 79].
